tuv.seg: • Obligations on owners and occupiers of protected structures
• Cá háit a ndéanfaidh mé iarratas

A protected structure is a structure that a planning authority considers to be of special interest from an architectural, historical, archaeological, artistic, cultural, scientific, social or technical point of view

Is ionann agus struchtúr atá faoi chosaint aon struchtúr a mheasann údarás pleanála a bheith ina ábhar sainspéise ó thaobh ailtireachta, staire, seandálaíochta, ealaíne, cultúir, eolaíochta, sóisialta nó teicneolaíochta de
If you are the owner or occupier of a protected structure, you are legally obliged to prevent it becoming endangered, whether through damage or neglect
Más úinéir nó áititheoir struchtúir atá faoi chosaint thú, tá dualgas de réir an dlí ort gan é a éirí i mbaol trí dhochar nó fhaillí
This document describes the protection given to these structures under Part IV of the Planning and Development Act 2000
Cuireann an doiciméid seo síos ar an chosaint atá tugtha do na struchtúir seo faoi Chuid IV den Acht um Pleanáil agus Forbairt 2000
A structure must be listed on the planning authority’s Record of Protected Structures (RPS) to qualify for protected status under the Act
Ní mór don struchtúr bheith liostaithe ar Thaifead na Struchtúr atá faoi Chosaint (RPS) chun cáiliú ar stádas cosanta faoin Acht
Each planning authority is obliged to keep a RPS as part of its development plan
Tá dualgas ar gach údarás RPS a choinneáil mar chuid dena bplean forbartha
The RPS must include every structure in the planning authority's area which it considers to be of special interest
Ní mór don RPS gach struchtúr a mheasann údarás pleanála a bheith ina ábhar sainspéise atá ina limistéar feidhmiúcháin aige, a chur san áireamh

Inclusion of these structures in the RPS means that their importance is recognised, they are legally protected from harm and all future changes to the structure are controlled and managed through the development control process (for example, planning permission) or by issuing a declaration under Section 57 of the Planning and Development Act 2000

Agus iad á gcur in áireamh RPS aithnítear tábhachtach na struchtúr seo, cosnaítear go dlíthiúil ó dhochar iad agus rialaítear agus bainistítear gach athrú don struchtúr sa todhchaí trí fhorbairt chóras rialacháin (mar shampla, cead pleanála) nó trí eisiúint dearbhaithe faoi Alt 57 den Acht um Pleanáil agus Forbairt 2000
If a structure is included in the RPS, the protection extends to the interior of the structure; to the land in its curtilage; and to any other structures on that land and their interiors
Má tá struchtúr cuimsithe ar RPS, tá cosaint ar thaobh istigh an struchtúir don talún atá ina chúirtealáiste agus do struchtúr ar bith eile ar an talamh sin agus dona dtaobh istigh
Curtilage means the land and outbuildings immediately surrounding a structure which is (or was) used for the purposes of the structure
Ciallaíonn cúirtealáiste talamh agus foirgnimh atá díreach timpeall ar struchtúr atá (nó a bhí) mar chuid den struchtúr é féin
This obligation also applies to all fixtures and features forming part of the interior and exterior of the protected structure or any structure on the grounds attached to it
Baineann an dualgas seo le gach daingneán agus sainghné atá mar chuid de thaobh istigh agus taobh amuigh den struchtúr atá faoi chosaint nó struchtúr ar bith ar an talamh atá ceangailte leis
If there is an urgent need for repairs to a protected structure, a grant may be available under the Structures at Risk Fund (pdf)
Is féidir cur isteach ar dheontas (pdf) le haghaidh obair phráinneach ar struchtúr atá faoi chosaint
The planning authority can add and delete structures from its RPS when reviewing its development plan or at any other time
Is féidir leis an údarás pleanála struchtúir a chur lena RPS nó a bhaint óna RPS nuair a dhéanann sé athbhreithniú ar a bplean forbartha nó ag am ar bith eile
Three stages must be gone through before a structure can be added to the RPS:
Tá trí chéim ann chun struchtúr a chur leis an RPS:
Identification of protected structures
Chun struchtúir le cur faoi chosaint a aithint
A planning authority can use a number of different sources to help it to identify structures for protection
Is féidir leis an údarás pleanála líon foinsí a úsáid chun cuidiú leis struchtúir a aithint le haghaidh cosanta
• A planning authority can carry out a survey of its area to determine if there are structures that should be added to the RPS
• Is féidir le húdarás pleanála suirbhé a dhéanamh ar an limistéar feidhmiúcháin aige le fáil amach má tá struchtúir ann a chaithfear chur leis an RPS
• The National Inventory of Architectural Heritage (NIAH) compiles records of Ireland's architectural heritage
• Tiomsaíonn Fardal Náisiúnta na hOidhreachta Ailtireachta (FNOA) taifid d’oidhreacht ailtireacht na hÉireann
It provides planning authorities with details of surveys of their area
Soláthraíonn siad sonraí ar suirbhéanna ar a limistéar feidhmiúcháin do húdaráis áitiúla
NIAH surveys may be used by the Minister for Arts, Heritage, Regional, Rural and Gaeltacht Affairs to make recommendations on structures to be added to the RPS
Is féidir leis an Aire Ealaíon, Oidhreachta agus Gaeltachta úsáid a bhaint as suirbhéanna de chuid FNOA chun moltaí a dhéanamh ar struchtúir le chur leis an RPS
It is up to the planning authority to decide if any of the structures recommended should be included in the RPS
Is leis an údarás pleanála an cinneadh chun struchtúir mholta a chur leis an RPS
• The Minister can also make recommendations to a planning authority to include individual structures in the RPS
• Is féidir leis an Aire Ealaíon, Oidhreachta, Gnóthaí Réigiúnacha, Tuaithe agus Gaeltachta moltaí a dhéanamh d’údarás áitiúil chun struchtúir aonair a chur leis an RPS
• Anyone can write to a planning authority to recommend a structure for protection, but the decision to include it in the RPS can only be made by the elected members of the planning authority
• Is féidir le duine ar bith scríobh chuig údarás áitiúil chun struchtúr a mholadh le haghaidh cosanta ach is le baill thofa an údaráis áitiúil amháin an cinneadh chun iad a chur leis an RPS
Assessment of protected structures
Chun struchtúir le cur faoi chosaint a mheas

A planning authority decides whether a structure should be included in the Record of Protected Structures (RPS) by identifying characteristics of special interest under the following headings: architectural, historical, archaeological, artistic, cultural, scientific, technical, and social

Déanann údarás pleanála cinneadh chun struchtúr a chur le Thaifead Struchtúr atá faoi Chosaint (RPS) trí shaintréithe atá ina ábhar sainspéise a aithint faoi na ceannteidil a leanas: ailtireacht, staire, seandálaíochta ealaín, cultúir, eolaíocht, teicneolaíocht agus sóisialta
The assessment process should be impartial and objective
Ba cheart go mbeadh an córas measúnachta neamhchlaonta agus réadach
Notification of addition to the Record of Protected Structures
Chun breis ar Thaifead na Struchtúr atá faoi Chosaint a chur in iúl
If the planning authority decides to consider a structure for inclusion in the RPS, it must go through the process laid down in the 2000 Act
Má chinneann an t-údarás áitiúil struchtúr le cur leis an RPS a mheas, ní mór dó próiseas a leanúint mar atá leagtha síos san Acht 2000
It must notify the owner and occupier that the structure is a ‘proposed protected structure’
Ní mór dó cur in iúl don úinéir agus don áititheoir gur ‘struchtúr molta le cur faoi chosaint’ é an struchtúr
This means the structure has the same protection as a structure already on the RPS pending the final decision of the planning authority
Ciallaíonn seo gurb ionann an cosaint atá ag an struchtúr agus atá ag struchtúr ar RPS cheana féin go dtí go ndéanfar cinneadh deireanach an údaráis áitiúil

The planning authority must also inform the Minister of the proposed addition, along with a number of bodies prescribed by the Planning and Development Regulations (pdf), including the Heritage Council, the Arts Council, Fáilte Ireland and An Taisce

Ní mór don údarás áitiúil cur in iúl do líon comhlachtaí atá forordaithe ag na Rialacháin um Pleanáil agus Forbairt (pdf) faoin bhreis atá á moladh, ina n-airítear an t-Aire Ealaíon, Oidhreachta agus Gaeltachta, An Chomhairle Oidhreachta, An Chomhairle Ealaíona, Fáilte Ireland agus An Taisce

Details of proposed additions to the RPS must be displayed in public for at least 6 weeks (10 weeks if it is done during the making of a development plan), during which time anyone, including the owner or occupier of the structure, has the right to comment on the proposal to the planning authority

Is gá sonraí ar na breiseanna don RPS atá á moladh a chur ar taispeáint ar feadh 6 seachtaine (10 seachtaine má tá sé molta le linn plean forbartha a dhéanamh), le linn an ama seo a bhfuil ceart ag duine ar bith, ina n-airítear úinéir nó áititheoir an struchtúir, a gcuid barúlacha ar an mholadh a léiriú don údarás pleanála
These comments will be taken into account before the authority’s elected members decide whether or not the structure should become a protected structure
Cuirtear na barúlacha seo san áireamh sula gcinneann baill thofa an údaráis más ceart nó mura ceart don struchtúr bheith ina struchtúr faoi chosaint
The decision to list the structure in the RPS must be made within 12 weeks of the end of the display period
Ní mór don cinneadh chun an struchtúr a liostáil sa RPS a dhéanamh laistigh de 2 seachtaine déag ó thréimhse dheireadh na taispeána
The planning authority must notify the owner and occupier of the structure of their decision within 2 weeks
Ní mór don údarás pleanála a gcinneadh a chur in iúl d’úinéir agus d’áititheoir an struchtúir laistigh de 2 seachtaine
If a structure is to be deleted from the list, the same process must be followed
Má tá struchtúr le baint on liosta, ní mór don próiseas céanna a líonadh

Details of the structure proposed for deletion must be displayed in public and any comments or objections from the public or the owner/occupier must be taken into account by the elected members of the planning authority when making their decision

Ní mór do shonraí an struchtúir atá molta le haghaidh bainte a chur ar taispeáint go poiblí agus caithfear barúlacha nó agóidí ón phobal nó ón úinéir/áititheoir a chur san áireamh ag baill thofa an údaráis áitiúil agus iad ag teacht chun cinnidh
Owners or occupiers of protected structures are legally required to make sure that the structure does not become endangered through neglect, decay, damage or harm
Tá dualgas de réir an dlí ag úinéirí nó áititheoirí na struchtúr atá faoi chosaint le cinntiú nach n-éiríonn an struchtúr i mbaol de bharr faillí, lobhadh, damáiste, nó dochar

Generally, if a structure is kept in habitable condition and regular maintenance is carried out (such as cleaning out gutters, repairing missing slates, repainting external timberwork) it should not become endangered

Go ginearálta, má choinnítear struchtúr i gcruth ináitrithe agus má dhéantar gnáthchothabháil air (cosúil le glanadh na ngáitéar, deisiú sclátaí scaoilte, athphéinteáil adhmaid atá taobh amuigh), ní amhlaidh go n-éireoidh sé i mbaol
If a protected structure is endangered, the planning authority can serve a notice on the owner or occupier, requiring them to carry out any work that it considers necessary to protect the structure

Má éiríonn struchtúr atá faoi chosaint i mbaol, is féidir leis an údarás pleanála fógra a sheirbheáil ar an úinéir nó áititheoir, ag éileamh orthu obair a chomhlíonadh a mheatar oiriúnach chun an struchtúr a chosaint
The work must be done within 8 weeks of the date of the notice
Ní mór don obair bheith déanta laistigh d’ocht seachtaine de dháta an fhógra
The planning authority can also service a notice to require the ‘restoration of character’ of the protected structure
Is féidir leis an údarás pleanála fógra a sheirbheáil a éilíonn ' athchóiriú saintréithe’ an struchtúir atá faoi chosaint
This could include removing, changing or replacing any parts of the structure specified in the notice
Is féidir le baint, athrú, athchur cuid ar bith den struchtúr a léirítear san fhógra a chur san áireamh leis seo
Owners or occupiers can make written representations to the planning authority about the terms of the notice
Tig le húinéirí nó áititheoirí uiríll a dhéanamh don údarás áitiúil faoi théarmaí an fhógra
They may request more time or financial help to comply with the notice
Tig leo tuilleadh ama nó cúnamh airgeadais a iarraidh chun chomhlíonadh leis an fhógra
In many cases, they may be eligible for a conservation grant
I gcuid mhór cásanna, is féidir go bhfuil siad i dteideal deontas caomhnaithe
The planning authority will take these representations into account when making their final decision
Cuirfidh an t-údarás áitiúil na huiríll seo san áireamh agus iad ag déanamh a gcinnidh deireanaigh
Owners and occupiers can appeal against the notice to the District Court within 2 weeks of their last response from the planning authority, if they are still not satisfied

Is féidir le húinéirí agus áititheoirí achomharc a chur isteach in aghaidh an fhógra don Chúirt Dúiche laistigh de 2 seachtaine óna fhreagra deireanach ón údarás pleanála, mura bhfuil siad sásta go fóill
If a notice to prevent a structure from becoming endangered has been ignored, the planning authority can take enforcement action
Má rinneadh neamhairde d’fhógra le baol a sheachaint ar struchtúr, thig leis an údarás pleanála gníomh forfheidhmiúcháin a dhéanamh
in the case of endangerment or restoration of character notices, the planning authority can carry out the work itself and recover the costs of the work from the owner or the occupier
I gcás fógraí i mbaol nó athchóiriú tréithe, is féidir leis an údarás pleanála an obair a dhéanamh é féin agus costais na hoibre a athshlánú ón úinéir nó áititheoir
In exceptional cases, the planning authority may buy the protected structure from the owner, either by compulsory purchase or by agreement
I gcásanna eisceachtúla, is féidir leis an údarás pleanála an struchtúr atá faoi chosaint a cheannach ón úinéir, idir trí cheannach éigeantach nó trí chomhaontú
This would only be done if the planning authority considered it the only way to save a protected structure
Ní dhéanfaí é seo ach dá mheasfadh an t-údarás pleanála gurbh é an t-aon dóigh amháin chun struchtúr atá faoi chosaint a shábháil

Under the Planning and Development Act 2000, there are penalties for owners or occupiers of protected structures who endanger the structure or who fail to carry out work that has been ordered by the planning authority

De réir an Acht Pleanála agus Forbartha, gearrtar pionóis ar úinéirí nó áititheoirí struchtúr atá faoi chosaint a chuireann an struchtúr i mbaol nó a theipeann orthu an obair, atá orduithe ag an údarás pleanála, a dhéanamh
If they are found guilty, they could be liable for fines of up to €12.7 million and/or a term of imprisonment of up to 2 years
Má tá siad ciontach, thig leo bheith faoi dhliteanas pionós suas go €12.7 milliún nó téarma príosúnachta suas go 2 bliana nó an dá rud acu araon

Planning permission is needed for work carried out on a protected structure that would materially affect its character. This means that many types of work, which in another building would be considered exempted development, may not be exempted where the building is a protected structure

Tá cead pleanála riachtanach chun obair a dhéanamh ar struchtúr atá faoi chosaint a mbeadh éifeacht bunúsach ar a saintréith Ciallaíonn sé go bhfuil cuid mhór cineálacha oibre ann, ar a measfaí forbairt díolúnach i bhfoirgnimh eile, nach mbeadh díolúnach i gcás struchtúr atá faoi chosaint
Depending on the nature of the structure and the features of interest even work such as painting the interior or replacing windows could affect its character and require planning permission

Is é ag brath ar nádúr an struchtúir agus ar sainghnéithe ar féidir le hobair, ar nós fiú péinteáil an taobh istigh nó athchur fuinneoga, chur isteach ar a charachtar agus cead pleanála a éileamh dá réir

If you are unsure about what works require planning permission for your particular building you can apply in writing to your planning authority for a declaration under Section 57 of the Planning and Development Act 2000 about the structure and its curtilage (or grounds attached)

Mura bhfuil tú cinnte faoin obair lena bhfuil cead pleanála riachtanach ar d’fhoirgneamh féin tig leat iarratas scríofa a chur isteach chuig d’údarás pleanála ar dhearbhú faoi Alt 57 den Acht um Pleanáil agus Forbairt 2000 faoin struchtúr agus a chúirtealáiste (nó talamh atá ceangailte)
This declaration states what types of work can be carried out without affecting the character of the structure
Luaitear sa dearbhú seo na cineálacha oibre ar féidir a dhéanamh gan chur isteach ar saintréithe an struchtúir
A declaration cannot exempt any works which would otherwise require planning permission
Ní féidir le dearbhú oibreacha a dhíolúnú a mbeadh cead pleanála orthu sa ghnáthchás
A planning authority will issue this declaration within 12 weeks of receiving a request
Eiseoidh údarás pleanála an dearbhú seo laistigh de 12 seachtaine ón uair a fhaigheann sé an t-iarratas
There is no fee for this service
Ní ghearrtar táille don tseirbhís seo
You can take a case to An Bord Pleanála if you disagree with the declaration issued to you
Tig leat cás a thabhairt do An Bord Pleanála mura n-aontaíonn tú leis an dearbhú a eisíodh duit
You must apply for planning permission in the usual way if more extensive work is planned
Ní mór duit chur isteach ar chead pleanála sa ghnáth dhóigh má tá obair níos fairsinge pleanáilte
However, you will need to include more detail, such as drawings, photographs or any other material necessary to explain how the proposed alterations would affect the character of the structure

Beidh ort, áfach, tuilleadh sonraí a chur isteach, ar nós líníochtaí, grianghraif, nó ábhar eile atá riachtanach le míniú ar an dóigh a gcuirfeadh na athruithe molta isteach ar charachtar an struchtúir
The newspaper and site notices for the planning application must state that the structure is a protected structure
Ní mór d’fhógraí an nuachtáin agus láithreáin le haghaidh cead pleanála a léiriú gur struchtúr atá faoi chosaint é an struchtúr
You should check with your planning authority to find out what additional information they require when applying for planning permission on a protected structure
Ba cheart duit seiceáil le d’údarás pleanála le fáil amach faoin eolas sa bhreis atá riachtanach agus tú ag cur isteach ar chead pleanála ar struchtúr atá faoi chosaint
If the planning authority has refused planning permission, you can appeal this decision to An Bord Pleanála
Má dhiúltaíonn an t-údarás pleanála cead pleanála, is féidir leat achomharc a chur isteach ar an chinneadh seo chuig An Bord Pleanála
The Department of Arts, Heritage, Regional, Rural and Gaeltacht Affairs has a number of useful publications in this area
Tá an iomad foilsiúchán ag an Roinn Ealaíon, Oidhreachta, Gnóthaí Réigiúnacha, Tuaithe agus Gaeltachta mar gheall ar an ábhar seo
• A series of practical advice leaflets on topics such as energy efficiency in traditional buildings (pdf) and repairing historic windows (pdf)
• Sraith bileog le comhairle phraiticiúil ar ábhair cosúil le héifeachtúlacht fuinnimh i bhfoirgintí traidisiúnta (pdf)
• A series of guidelines on Architectural Heritage Protection
• Sraith treoirlínte faoi Cosaint Oidhreachta Ailtireachta

These are statutory guidelines to which planning authorities must have regard in their work but they will also be of assistance to owners of protected structures, their advisers and everyone with an interest in architectural heritage

Is treoirlínte reachtúla iad seo nach mór do na húdaráis phleanála aird a thabhairt orthu ina gcuid oibre ach chomh maith leis sin beidh siad ina gcuidiú le húinéirí struchtúr atá faoi chosaint, lena gcomhairleoirí agus le duine ar bith a bhfuil suim aige san oidhreacht ailtireachta
• A series of detailed conservation guidelines to help architects, builders and owners to understand the guiding principles of conservation and restoration
• Sraith treoirlínte faoi chursaí caomhantais, chun cabhrú le hailtirí, tógálaithe agus úinéirí treoirphrionnsabail an chaomhantais agus an athchóirithe a thuiscint
Copies of these publications can be purchased from the Government Publications Sales Office or downloaded free from the Department’s website
Is féidir cóipeanna a cheannach ón Oifig Dhíolta Foilseacháin Rialtais nó iad a íoslódáil saor in aisce ó shuíomh ghréasáin na Roinne

If you want to recommend a structure for protected status or if you have any questions relating to your protected structure, you should write to your planning authority Conservation Officer or the planning department of your local authority

Má theastaíonn uait struchtúr a mholadh le haghaidh stádais chosanta nó má tá ceist ar bith agat a bhaineann le do struchtúr atá faoi chosaint, ní mór duit scríobh chuig Oifigeach Caomhantais d’údaráis phleanála nó chuig roinn pleanála d’údaráis áitiúil
